page.title: 12Woodifield Farm.
page.content: Part of the area that we looked at contained Woodifield Farm.The farm takes its name possibly from Woden's field and it is believed that a Roman building was on the site where the farm now stands. The farm is at the top of Pea Hill and to the North of Fir Tree.The surrounding land slopes away in every direction which makes it an ideal place for viewing the countryside.The land belonging to the farm ranges from 525feet above sea level to a height of 750 feet,a distance of 225 feet over a half mile distance. Apart from the Dairy herd of Friesan cattle the fields are used for hay for feed during the winter which, can be rather hard with heavy falls of snow.
